intro: Didelta annua, commonly known as the annual delta plant, is a herbaceous species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with smooth or slightly hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous, allowing it to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Didelta annua is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
